text:
Hi, I am the host of this show,
"Cooking With Dog."

OK!  Let's have her, prepare the containers
for the plum syrup and plum wine.

whipe the pre-washed and then dried,
airtight containers with the 'Shochu.'
Damp the kitchen paper with the 'Shochu' and thoroughly wipe the inside of the containers.

This sanitising process is especially important,
to allow plum wine to age properly.
Also wipe the inner lid and the outer lid.

Next, let's prepare the green plums
for plum syrup and plum wine.
Transfer the pre-washed plums into two bowls.

Soak the plums in enough water,
for two (2:00) hours to remove the bitterness.
Strain the green plums.

Be careful, not to make any damage
on the plum skins.

Dry the plums thoroughly with a clean cloth
and the kitchen paper.

Remove the pit in the stem end of the plum,
with a bamboo skewer.
Okay, let's make plum syrup first.
Add the green plums in the sanitized container.
Add rock sugar.
Add the green plums again,
and rock sugar.

Finally, add vinegar to prevent
the plums from fermentation.

Seal the container, with the inner lid
and the outer lid.

For the first (1st) day, shake the container frequently,
to mix the plums, rock sugar and vinegar well.

Shake the container several times a day,
until all the rock sugar dissolves.
After three (3) weeks, all the plum juice is extracted
Okay, let's make plum wine.
Add the green plums in the sanitized container.
Add rock sugar,
and the plums again...
then, add rock sugar.

Add the 'Shochu' and submerge
the plums and the rock sugar.
Seal the container with a lid.
Store the container in a cold dark place.

Sometimes, rotate it to mix the plums
and sugar uniformly.

It takes six (6) months for
the plum wine to be drinkable.

Aging it one (1) to two (2) years
makes it full flavored.
Here is the plum wine, we made last year.

You can mix one fith (1/5) plum syrup
with four fifth (4/5) cold water,
carbonated water or milk.

Plum wine can be tasted on the rocks,
or mixed with carbonated water, or hot water.
Good luck in the kitchen!
